item.title: Knapsack problem algorithms for my real-life carry-on knapsack
item.author: hello@victoria.dev (Victoria)
item.description: The knapsack problem I’m a nomad and live out of one carry-on bag. This means that the total weight of all my worldly possessions must fall under airline cabin baggage weight limits - usually 10kg. On some smaller airlines, however, this weight limit drops to 7kg. Occasionally, I have to decide not to bring something with me to adjust to the smaller weight limit. As a practical exercise, deciding what to leave behind (or get rid of altogether) entails laying out all my things and choosing which ones to keep.

item.title: Things you need to know about becoming a Data Scientist
item.author: hello@victoria.dev (Victoria)
item.description: I recently attended a panel discussion hosted by General Assembly in Singapore entitled, “So you want to be a Data Scientist/Analyst”. The panel featured professionals in different stages of their careers and offered a wealth of information to an audience of hopefuls, including tips on how to land a job as a data scientist, and stories debunking myths that color this field. The panelists Misrab Faizullah-Khan - VP of Data Science, GO_JEK
